text: <@U1ENXTQRL>:  not quite sure what you mean here, but if you are implying that the peer nodes themselves can provide this functionality then the answer is no.  You'll still need to run the membersvcs executable.  You are correct in that you can run one single instance of memberscvs in order to handle the ACA,ECA,TCA and TLS functions

<@U0PB67X4K>:  Yes, that's what I meant. If there could be a special node _within_ the network that served as a "Certificate Authority", without having to trust in a third party. As far as I'm understanding, the answer to that is yes, right?
<@U1ENXTQRL>:   yeah - you can run your own "Certificate Authority" node which only your network interacts with with no reliance on a 3rd party to run it for you

Winner of a distributed ledger hack-a-thon earlier this week was an identity solution.  <https://godistributed.com/articles/distributed-identity-project-wins-k-hackathon-prize-at-distributed-trade-conference/> <http://devpost.com/software/distributed-id-diid>

attachments.title: Distributed Identity Project Wins $20k Hackathon Prize at Distributed: Trade Conference
attachments.text: A four-person project calling itself DIID – for Distributed ID – was awarded the $20,000 grand prize in the 24-hour hackathon that preceded the Distributed: Trade conference in St. Louis, Missouri earlier this week. The team developed a prototype of an application that provides a “solution to ...

attachments.title: Distributed ID (DIID)
